origin: Late Middle English from Old French, from medieval Latin portale, neuter (used as a noun) of portalis ‘like a gate’, from Latin porta ‘door, gate’.

definitions.definition: A doorway, gate, or other entrance, especially a large and imposing one.
definitions.example: I drove past the studios; the gates seemed like portals to some other world.

definitions.definition: A website or web page providing access or links to other sites.
definitions.example: many healthcare providers already utilize portals through which a patient can access test results

origin: Mid 19th century from modern Latin portalis, from Latin porta ‘gate’.

definitions.definition: Relating to an opening in an organ through which major blood vessels pass, especially the transverse fissure of the liver.
definitions.example: The liver biopsy specimen showed portal triads and sinusoids infiltrated with lymphoid cells.
